files.patch:
@@ -1080,2 +1080,2 @@ -
  • images or product-images - Build the -regular JDK image
    • +
  • images or product-images - Build the JDK +image
    • @@ -2026,5 +2026,5 @@ -rest of the "contains space" warnings from configure can be -ignored. You can choose any short name; once it is set, -configure's tools like cygpath can convert the -directory with spaces to your chosen short name and pass it to the build -system.

    +rest of the "contains space" warnings from configure, such +as IntelliJ IDEA, can be ignored. You can choose any short +name; once it is set, configure's tools like +cygpath can convert the directory with spaces to your +chosen short name and pass it to the build system.

@@ -882,1 +882,1 @@
-* `images` or `product-images` - Build the regular JDK image
+* `images` or `product-images` - Build the JDK image
@@ -1810,4 +1810,4 @@
-and `Windows Kits`; the rest of the "contains space" warnings from `configure`
-can be ignored. You can choose any short name; once it is set, `configure`'s
-tools like `cygpath` can convert the directory with spaces to your chosen short
-name and pass it to the build system.
+and `Windows Kits`; the rest of the "contains space" warnings from `configure`,
+such as `IntelliJ IDEA`, can be ignored. You can choose any short name; once it
+is set, `configure`'s tools like `cygpath` can convert the directory with spaces
+to your chosen short name and pass it to the build system.
